Name: VRRP enabled
Log Message Example: VRRP is now enabled for Cluster.
Description: Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol (VRRP) is now enabled for this Active/Passive Cluster.
Format: VRRP is now enabled for Cluster.
ID: Ð

Name: VRRP start master
Log Message Example: Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 started in master state.
Description: VRRP started in master state.
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d started in master state.
ID: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${value} started in master state.

Name: VR shutdown
Log Message Example: Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 returned to initial state.
Description: Virtual Router returned to initial state.
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d returned to initial state.
ID: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} returned to initial state

Name: VR pause
Log Message Example: Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 becomes backup on pause event
Description: Virtual Router becomes backup due to a pause event.
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d becomes backup on pause event
ID: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} becomes backup on pause event

Name: VR resume
Log Message Example: Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 becomes master on resume event
Description: Virtual Router becomes master due to a resume event.
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d becomes master on resume event
ID: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} becomes master on resume event

Name: VR backup state
Log Message Example: Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 state changed from master to backup
Description: Virtual Router state changed from master to backup
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d state changed from master to backup
ID: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} state changed from master to backup

Name: VR notification gap
Log Message Example: Member 80B20002E5BCD Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 changed state to master due to 3 second notification gap from current master with IP 10.0.4.1
Description: Member Virtual Router changed state to master due to notification gap from current master
Format: Member %s Virtual Router with cluster ID %d changed state to master due to %d second notification gap from current master with IP %s
ID: Member ${member} Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} changed state to master due to ${value} second notification gap from current master with IP ${ip}

Name: VRRP master state
Log Message Example: Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 state changed to master
Description: Virtual Router state changed to master
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d state changed to master
ID: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} state changed to master

Name: VRRP initialization failed
Log Message Example: Cluster VRRP initialization failed
Description: Initialization of Virtual Router Redundancy Protocol (VRRP) failed.
Format: Cluster VRRP initialization failed
ID: Ð

Name: DHCP overwrite
Log Message Example: A DHCP server is interfering with static address assignment of cluster IP address 10.0.0.1 on eth0. Disable DHCP server access to eth5.
Description: A DHCP server has attempted to assign an IP address to cluster member on the Cluster Interface. This log message recommends the admin isolate the Cluster interface network from the DHCP server, and specifies the interface number and IP address the cluster attempted to assign to the member.
Format: A DHCP server is interfering with static address assignment of cluster IP address %s on eth%d. Disable DHCP server access to eth%d.
ID: A DHCP server is interfering with static address assignment of cluster IP ${ip} on eth${port}. Please disable DHCP server access to eth${port}.

Name: Cluster interface up
Log Message Example: Cluster interface eth5 is up.
Description: Cluster interface link status changed to up.
Format: Cluster interface %s is up.
ID: Cluster interface ${ifname} is up.

Name: Cluster interface down
Log Message Example: Cluster interface eth5 is down.
Description: Cluster interface link status changed to down.
Format: Cluster interface %s is down.
ID: Cluster interface ${ifname} is down

Name: Time synchronization failure
Log Message Example: Cluster time synchronization failed.
Description: The cluster master's attempt to synchronize time to a cluster member failed
Format: Cluster time synchronization failed.
ID: Ð

Name: Configuration update
Log Message Example: Cluster member 80B20002E5BCD received updated configuration; version 3.
Description: Cluster member received an updated configuration from the master. The log message specifies the member serial number and configuration version number.
Format: Cluster member %s received updated configuration; version %d.
ID: Cluster member ${member} received updated configuration; version ${version}.

Name: Channel status change
Log Message Example: Cluster channel from member 80B20002E5BCD to master is up
Description: The cluster communication channel between the specified members changed state.
Format: Cluster channel from member %s to master is %s.
ID: Cluster channel from member ${member} to master is ${state}.

Name: Cluster interface down
Log Message Example: Cluster interface eth5 is down.
Description: The specified Cluster interface is down.
Format: Cluster interface %s is down.
ID: Cluster interface ${ifname} is down.

Name: VR enabled
Log Message Example: Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 is now enabled
Description: The Virtual Router representing the cluster is now enabled
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d is now enabled
ID: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} is now enabled

Name: VR disabled
Log Message Example: Virtual Router with cluster ID 1 is now disabled
Description: The Virtual Router representing the cluster is now disabled
Format: Virtual Router with cluster ID %d is now disabled
ID: Virtual Router with cluster ID ${id} is now disabled

Name: Cluster disabled
Log Message Example: Cluster disabled. Non-master member 80B20002E5BCD will be reset to factory-default settings.
Description: The non-master member of the cluster will be reset to factory default-settings because FireCluster is disabled.
Format: Cluster disabled. Non-master member %s will be reset to factory-default settings.
ID: Cluster disabled. Non-master member %s will be reset to factory-default settings.

Name: Critical configuration change
Log Message Example: Non-master member 80B20002E5BCD will be reset to factory-default settings due to a critical cluster configuration change.
Description: The non-master member of the cluster will be reset to factory-default settings due to a critical configuration change. A configuration change is critical if it would cause the master and backup master to lose the TCP connection on the cluster interface.
Format: Non-master member %s will be reset to factory-default settings due to a critical cluster configuration change.
ID: Non-master member ${member} will be reset to factory default-settings due to a critical cluster configuration change.

Name: Device discovery failed
Log Message Example: Cluster master 80B20002E5BCD was unable to issue a device discovery message.
Description: The cluster master was unable to issue a device discovery message.
Format: Cluster master %s was unable to issue a device discovery message.
ID: Cluster master ${master} was unable to issue a device discovery message.

Name: Member ready to join
Log Message Example: Member 80B20002E5BCD is ready to join the cluster.
Description: Local member has FireCluster enabled and is ready to join.
Format: Member %s is ready to join the cluster.
ID: Member ${member} is ready to join the cluster.

Name: Cluster enabled
Log Message Example: Cluster enabled on member 80B20002E5BCD.
Description: Cluster was enabled on the specified member.
Format: Cluster enabled on member %s.
ID: Cluster enabled on member ${member}.

Name: Cluster disabled on master
Log Message Example: Cluster disabled on cluster master 80B20002E5BCD.
Description: Cluster disabled on the cluster member while it was the cluster master.
Format: Cluster disabled on cluster master %s.
ID: Cluster disabled on cluster master ${master}.

Name: Non-master member removed
Log Message Example: Non-master cluster member 80B20002E5BCD was removed from cluster, and will be reset to factory-default settings.
Description: The non-master member of the Cluster will be reset to factory-default settings because it was removed from the cluster.
Format: Non-master cluster member %s was removed from cluster, and will be reset to factory-default settings.
ID: Non-master cluster member %s was removed from cluster, and will be reset to factory-default settings.

Name: Factory-default reset failed
Log Message Example: Failed to reset cluster member 80B20002E5BCD to factory-default settings.
Description: Failed to reset to factory-default settings.
Format: Failed to reset cluster member %s to factory-default settings.
ID: Failed to reset member ${member} to factory-default settings.

Name: Heartbeat lost
Log Message Example: Master 80B20002E5BFE detected loss of heartbeat from member 80B20002E5BCD, cluster channel is up.
Description: The specified Cluster failed to receive a heartbeat message.
Format: Master %s detected loss of heartbeat from member %s, cluster channel is up.
ID: Master ${master} detected loss of heartbeat from member ${member}, cluster channel is up.

Name: Member promoted to master
Log Message Example: Member 80B20002E5BCD is now master.
Description: The specified member has become master.
Format: Member %s is now master.
ID: Member ${member} is now master.

Name: Failover due to WAI
Log Message Example: Master 80B20002E5BCD failed over to member 80B20002E5BFE, which has a greater Weighted Average Index.
Description: The master failed over to the specified member because that member has a higher health score than the master.
Format: Master %s failed over to member %s, which has a greater Weighted Average Index.
ID: Master ${master} failover to member ${member} with greater Weighted Average Index.

Name: Member role change
Log Message Example: Member 80B20002E5BCD changed role to master
Description: The cluster member changed to the specified role.
Format: Member %s changed role to %s.
ID: Member ${member} role changed to ${role}.

Name: Interface link status change
Log Message Example: Monitored interface eth0 link is down.
Description: Specified monitored interface link status changed, which will change the health index for the member.
Format: Monitored interface %s link is %s.
ID: Monitored interface ${ifname} link is ${state}.

Name: New master
Log Message Example: Member 80B20002E5BCD took over as master from member 80B20002E5BFE.
Description: The specified member has taken over as master..
Format: Member %s took over as master from member %s.
ID: Member ${member} took over as master from member ${member}.

Name: Failover initiated by administrator
Log Message Example: Master 80B20002E5BCD initiated failover by administrator request.
Description: The administrator has initiated a failover.
Format: Master %s initiated failover by administrator request.
ID: Master ${master} initiated failover by administrator request..

Name: Cannot initiate failover
Log Message Example: Cannot initiate failover from master 80B20002E5BCD to member 80B20002E5BFE due to higher Weighted Average Index on current master or backup master is unreachable.
Description: The failover requested by administrator cannot proceed because the master has a higher health index, or the backup master is unreachable.
Format: Cannot initiate failover from master %s to member %s due to higher Weighted Average Index on current master or backup master is unreachable.
ID: Cannot initiate failover from master ${master} to member ${member} due to higher Weighted Average Index on current master or other member is unreachable.

Name: Failover due to interface state change
Log Message Example: Cluster failover due to interface eth4 link down event.
Description: A cluster failover event occurred due to a change of interface state.
Format: Cluster failover due to interface %s link %s event.
ID: Cluster failover due to interface ${ifname} link ${state} event.

Name: Member Role Change
Log Message Example: Cluster member 80B20002E5BCD changed role from idle to backup master
Description: The role of the specified Cluster member changed.
Format: Cluster member %s changed role from %s to %s.
ID: Cluster member ${member} changed role from ${role} to ${role}.

Name: Synchronization failed
Log Message Example: Full state synchronization from master 80B20002E5BCD to backup master 80B20002E5BFE failed.
Description: Full state synchronization from the master to the specified member failed. Member state will not change to Backup Master.
Format: Full state synchronization from master %s to backup master %s failed.
ID: Full state synchronization from master ${master} to backup master ${member} failed.

Name: Synchronization timeout
Log Message Example: Full state synchronization from master 80B20002E5BCD to backup master 80B20002E5BFE timed out.
Description: Full state synchronization from the master to the specified member timed out. Member state will not change to Backup Master.
Format: Full state synchronization from master %s to backup master %s timed out.
ID: Full state synchronization from master ${master} to backup master ${member} timed out.

Name: Synchronization successful
Log Message Example: Full state synchronization from master 80B20002E5BCD to backup master 80B20002E5BFE completed successfully.
Description: Full state synchronization to the specified member was successful. Member status changed to backup master.
Format: Full state synchronization from master %s to backup master %s completed successfully.
ID: Full state synchronization from master ${master} to backup master ${member} completed successfully

Name: Failover due to link-down
Log Message Example: Master 80B20002E5BCD failed-over to member 80B20002E5BFE due to a link-down event on interface eth3.
Description: Cluster failover due to a link failure on the current master, which now has a health index lower than the backup master. The log message specifies which interface has the link down.
Format: Master %s failed-over to member %s due to a link-down event on interface %s.
ID: Master ${master} failed-over to member ${member} due to a link-down event on interface ${ifname}.
